text: Last week’s funding bill provided $1.5 billion for State Opioid Response Grants to allow states to create action plans that meet the needs of their states. In @GOPHELP and @GOPSenFinance, we are continuing to work on comprehensive legislation to address the #opioidcrisis, too.

html: It's #OverdoseAwarenessDay. Last week, the Senate approved an increase in funding for the fourth year in a row for opioid treatment, prevention and recovery programs. This epidemic has harmed too many families already, including my own. We’re working to stop it.

html: While August is typically spent in our home states, this month, we’ve spent much of our time in Washington. We’ve passed six necessary bills to fund the government and direct our spending in important areas such as defense, health care, education and labor.

html: Thanks to the U.S. House for its passage of bipartisan legislation to reauthorize the Children’s Hospital Graduate Medical Education program for our pediatric workforce yesterday. We passed our Senate version in @GOPHELP in April, and I hope for a full Senate vote soon!
text: Thanks to the U.S. House for its passage of bipartisan legislation to reauthorize the Children’s Hospital Graduate Medical Education program for our pediatric workforce yesterday. We passed our Senate version in @GOPHELP in April, and I hope for a full Senate vote soon!

html: Very pleased that the #PerkinsCTE reauthorization passed the Senate yesterday. This legislation will help prepare America’s students more effectively for skilled jobs and give states more flexibility to better align skills training with local needs.
text: Very pleased that the #PerkinsCTE reauthorization passed the Senate yesterday. This legislation will help prepare America’s students more effectively for skilled jobs and give states more flexibility to better align skills training with local needs.

html: On Monday, the Senate is expected to vote on Robert Wilkie’s nomination to lead @DeptVetAffairs. He is eminently qualified for the position, as evidenced by his overwhelmingly bipartisan approval out of @VAChair committee, and I stand ready to help him succeed for our veterans.
text: On Monday, the Senate is expected to vote on Robert Wilkie’s nomination to lead @DeptVetAffairs. He is eminently qualified for the position, as evidenced by his overwhelmingly bipartisan approval out of @VAChair committee, and I stand ready to help him succeed for our veterans.

html: It was my honor to finally present Mr. Ralph Rumsey of Woodstock, Ga., with the medal he earned in his service to our country during WWII. Mr. Rumsey was held as a prisoner of war in Germany for nearly six months in 1945 while he served in the U.S. Army. https://www.isakson.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2018/7/isakson-presents-prisoner-of-war-medal-to-world-war-ii-veteran …pic.twitter.com/77D07Z1Gy8

html: I appreciate POTUS's commitment to reducing skills gaps between 21st century jobs & the students & employees seeking them. I’m proud to have worked on #WIOA to provide streamlined funding to states for workforce development & to be continuing our work to reauthorize #PerkinsCTE.
text: I appreciate POTUS's commitment to reducing skills gaps between 21st century jobs & the students & employees seeking them. I’m proud to have worked on #WIOA to provide streamlined funding to states for workforce development & to be continuing our work to reauthorize #PerkinsCTE.

html: No current or former American diplomat, civil servant, political appointee, law enforcement official, or member of the armed forces should be turned over for questioning by the government of Vladimir Putin. We just passed a Senate resolution expressing that by a vote of 98-0.
text: No current or former American diplomat, civil servant, political appointee, law enforcement official, or member of the armed forces should be turned over for questioning by the government of Vladimir Putin. We just passed a Senate resolution expressing that by a vote of 98-0.

html: I support the assessment of the intel community & the bipartisan Senate Intel Committee findings that Russia interfered in the 2016 election - just as it has done for decades. Russia does not deserve our trust or special treatment, and my view remains unchanged after today's mtg.
text: I support the assessment of the intel community & the bipartisan Senate Intel Committee findings that Russia interfered in the 2016 election - just as it has done for decades. Russia does not deserve our trust or special treatment, and my view remains unchanged after today's mtg.
